Articles.Content: I think that on Christmas they should have this thing on the KSP store where you can get any paid version but only on christmas. who supports it?

They've previously said they had plans to release a "Collector's Edition" of KSP, which would include all past versions, at some point, likely after v1.0 is released. Other than that, all I can see for something like this is more server woes for Squad as everyone scrambles to download older versions to see what it used to be like on Christmas Day.

There was a thread floating around here that collected all of the free version of the game.

I'm sure it wouldn't be too hard to set something like that up with a purchase-verification system. Hell, even putting a bit on our sigs that flags whether we're paid or free, and then let us as a community circulate the tapes amongst ourselves.

That thread's in General Discussion, probably floating around on page 2 or 3 or thereabouts.

No, letting the community freely circulate paid versions of KSP, old or not, will only encourage piracy, I think. It's not as if the devs focus on obliterating it, but blatantly encouraging it they probably will avoid...

I still have the .zips of many of the previous versions, but they're really more of a novelty. Play for a few minutes just to remember what it was like, but any more than that and you start missing all the features that have been added, and mod support is awful.

By christmas you mean the holiday season right?

Ahh, whatever with he politically correct stuff.

I think that they should just offer a christmas pack or an easter egg pack or something that is special that you can add to the game..

The collector's pack sounds too bulky and useless. I'd like to get like a free kerbalizer or dlc or something.
